Content:: Ala Nemerenco (pronunciation: [nemeˈrenko]; born 21 August 1959) is a Moldovan physician and politician. As of 6 August 2021[update], she serves as Minister of Health in the cabinet of Prime Minister Natalia Gavrilița. She served as Minister of Health, Labour and Social Protection from 8 June 2019 to 14 November 2019 in the cabinet of Prime Minister Maia Sandu.[1] Viorica Dumbrăveanu was appointed as her successor.[2][3]  This article about a Moldovan politician is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
